channel.title: NASA Johnson Space Center - News and Features

item.title: Maryland Students, Navy Pilots to Hear from NASA Astronauts in Space
item.description: Pilots from the U.S. Naval Test Pilot School in Patuxent River, Maryland, and students across southern Maryland will have an opportunity this week to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
item.source: NASA Johnson Space Center - News and Features

item.title: NASA to Participate in ASCEND Conference, Brief Media on Tech Demo
item.description: NASA leaders, including Deputy Administrator Pam Melroy, will participate in the 2022 ASCEND conference, hosted by the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) in Las Vegas from Monday, Oct. 24, through Wednesday, Oct. 26.
item.source: NASA Johnson Space Center - News and Features

item.title: Moonwalking Test Mission Daily Field Log
item.description: During JETT3, two NASA astronauts traversed the lunar-like environment of the San Francisco Volcanic Field located north of Flagstaff, Arizona.
item.source: NASA Johnson Space Center - News and Features

item.title: NASA: Charla en directo con el astronauta Frank Rubio desde el espacio
item.description: El astronauta de la NASA Frank Rubio discutirá su primer mes viviendo y trabajando en la Estación Espacial Internacional en una conversación en directo y en español con Diana Trujillo, directora de vuelo de la NASA, el viernes 21 de octubre a las 12 p.m. EDT.
item.source: NASA Johnson Space Center - News and Features

item.title: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-4 Astronauts Safely Splash Down in Atlantic
item.description: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-4 astronauts aboard the Dragon spacecraft safely splashed down Friday off the coast of Jacksonville, Florida, completing the agency’s fourth commercial crew mission to the International Space Station. The international crew of four spent 170 days in orbit.
item.source: NASA Johnson Space Center - News and Features

item.title: Meet the Desert RATS Crew for Upcoming Artemis Rover Mission Simulations
item.description: As NASA works to develop technologies needed to establish a long-term presence at the Moon with future Artemis missions, pressurized rovers in which humans can live and work will play an important role.
item.source: NASA Johnson Space Center - News and Features

item.title: Space Rocks, Moon Tools, and Astronauts on ‘NASA Explorers’ Video Series
item.description: It’s not rockets and satellites that make NASA soar. It’s people. On season 5 of NASA Explorers, “Artemis Generation,” you’ll meet the scientists and engineers who are studying Moon rocks, building tools, working aboard NASA’s International Space Station, and training astronauts in preparation for landing humans on the Moon.
item.source: NASA Johnson Space Center - News and Features

item.title: NASA’s SpaceX Crew-5 Launches to International Space Station
item.description: The crew members assigned to NASA’s SpaceX Crew-5 mission are in orbit following their launch to the International Space Station noon EDT Wednesday, from Launch Complex 39A at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida.
item.source: NASA Johnson Space Center - News and Features

item.title: Meet the Teams Leading Moonwalking Test Mission
item.description: The remote, rocky, high-desert terrain of the S P Crater near Flagstaff, Arizona will serve as lunar proxy for a mission simulation called Joint Extravehicular Activity Test Team Field Test #3 (JETT3) scheduled for Oct. 4-9, 2022.
item.source: NASA Johnson Space Center - News and Features

item.title: NASA to Practice Artemis Moonwalking, Roving Operations in Arizona Desert
item.description: To prepare for the Artemis era of research on the Moon, NASA will conduct two, multi-week field tests near Flagstaff, Arizona.
item.source: NASA Johnson Space Center - News and Features
